records.csr module¶

CSR Records

Handles the record structures for the CSR service

class records.csr.Action(record={}, custom={})¶

Bases: RestOC.Record_MySQL.Record

Represents an action taken

classmethod agentCounts(range_, memo_ids=None, custom={})¶

Agent Counts

Returns the count per type of outgoing item by agent

Parameters

  • range (list) – The timestamp start and end to look up

  • memo_ids (list) – Optional, the list of agents to look for

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

Returns

list

classmethod byRange(start, end, memo_id=None, custom={})¶

By Range

Returns the actions in the given date/time range and single or group of agents

Parameters

  • start (uint) – The start timestamp of the range

  • end (uint) – The end timestamp of the range

  • memo_id (int) – The ID of the memo user to fetch tickets for

Returns

list

Memo IDs by Type

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

classmethod idsByRange(start, end, memo_id=None, custom={})¶

User Associated

Combines the opened, resolved, and actions tables into a single union and returns the distinct ticket IDs found to be associated in the given date/time range

Parameters

  • start (uint) – The start timestamp of the range

  • end (uint) – The end timestamp of the range

  • memo_id (int) – The ID of the memo user to fetch tickets for

Returns

list

classmethod unresolved(filter, custom={})¶

Unresolved

Returns the ID if any ticket is found not yet resolved based on the filter

Parameters

  • filter (dict) – The filter to use for the lookup

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

Returns

str|None

classmethod withState(ids=None, custom={})¶

With State

Returns tickets with their associated opened and resolved records based on the given IDs. To first get IDs take a look at the idsByRange method

Parameters

  • ids (str[]) – List of IDs to return

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

Returns

list

Add SMS

Adds a list of SMS ids while ignoring any duplicates

Parameters

  • ids (list) – The IDs to add as items

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

Returns

None

classmethod countByUser(memo_id, range_=None, custom={})¶

Count By User

Returns the total count of opened tickets by a specific user, with or without a specific range

Parameters

  • memo_id (uint) – The ID of the user

  • range (list) – Optional range to filter by, 0 = start, 1 = end

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

Returns

uint

classmethod counts(start, end, custom={})¶

Counts

Returns the counts group by the users

Parameters

  • start (int) – The starting timestamp

  • end (int) – The ending timestamp

  • custom (dict) – Custom Host and DB info ‘host’ the name of the host to get/set data on ‘append’ optional postfix for dynamic DBs

Returns

uint
